data.title: Manila Central University, Caloocan, Philippines
data.text:
Location - Manila Central University, Caloocan, Philippines

Caloocan, also known as Kalookan is a city with an exotic culture dating back centuries, rose back from the ruins of World War II and managed to become one of the fastest growing centers of industrialization as well as a residential suburb in the Philippines. Bordering the capital of Manila on the island of Luzon with over 1.5 million residents Caloocan is nostalgically fast-paced with skyrise buildings and an abundance of cultural gems to be discovered here. One can explore the rich history of the country here on Bonifacio Circle Monumento- a proud symbol of Philippines unity in the days of the revolution, San Roque Cathedral blessed by Pope John II, the Taoist Temple, ancient tombs in La Loma Cemetery & the Chinese cemetery, exotic museums, malls, and resorts.

With the temperature variations between 26 to 32 degrees, its warm summer days and beautiful rainy season Caloocan is perfect for those who love tropical destinations.

Study MBBS in the Philippines- Manila Central University

Established in 1903 as the first Philippino-run pharmacy school, Manila Central University expanded its experience into numerous health sciences, business, technology, basic education, medicine, and graduate studies. Over 119 years the university has excelled through the times and continually has passed on to its students the expertise only time can perfect. With a vision to become ‘A Leading Filipino University Sharing Talents To The World’ MCU Nurture Transformative Learning Experiences.

The university provides multiple flexible payment options ranging from quarterly to monthly payment plans. Students are spared from the burden of making larger amounts of payment once along with 11 Scholarship programs for eligible students.

MCU in its 119 years journey has produced more than 58000 graduates with exemplarily successful careers in health sciences, technology, business, Medicine, and arts.

Offering 23 active programs ranging from preschool to post-graduate studies.

More than 41 active organizations and clubs for students to develop social and academic awareness and develop cultural, religious, social, and academic undertakings as demanded by their profession and also to act as a liaison between faculties and students.

The university has 10 Major Colleges for Graduate Students

College of Pharmacy

College of Dentistry

College of Arts and Science

College of Business Management

College of Medicine

College of Nursing

College of Optometry

College of Medical Technology

College of Physical Therapy

Institute of Education

Why choose Manila Central University for MBBS in the Philippines?

MCU is one of the seven pioneer medical schools in the Philippines with an extensive alumni network and full support and exposure from its partner tertiary hospital, the College of Medicine will make you an exceptional doctor. Some of the best reasons to choose MCU are as follows:

Medical Degree from MCU is approved by National Medical Council (NMC) or MCI approved, hence it is valid in India.

It is recognized by the WHO, FAIMER, CHED, and USMLE.

Medium of teaching at the University for MBBS course is English hence it is ideal for international students

Given its Level I accreditation status by the Philippine Accrediting Association of Schools, Colleges, and Universities (PAASCU), an external body that checks the quality standards of universities, the college continues to provide word class, advanced, and safe quality education.

From the traditional ways of examining the cadavers to using high technology 3D dissection table called the Anatomage specifically acquired to ensure the safety of students in the new normal without sacrificing the teaching and learning quality

MCU has its own base hospital where all clinical clerkships are conducted. Our students will have the opportunity to experience being trained in a real clinical setup in a tertiary hospital before they face the real world of being a physician.

Advantages of pursuing MBBS at Manila Central University

Course duration for MBBS if you study in the Philippines is 6 years (including 1 year of internship).

Manila Central University is recognized by MCI, WHO, etc. and Practical training is offered at Government Hospitals in the Philippines. Graduates will be qualified to write a unified national examination and start practicing in any of the countries of their choice.

The fees are reasonable and no donation is required for admission. MCU provides High-quality medical education at affordable prices.

MBBS in the Philippines prepares you for the USMLE (the United States Medical Licensing Examination). There is a significant number of doctors practicing in the USA are graduated from the Philippines. MCU provides expert training for these examinations.

Facilities in Manila Central University

The MCU has a cutting edge in campus hospital for the best practice.

The students can access Wi-Fi and the library 24 hours on campus for research and study.

Indian food is available at the canteens.

Magnificent boarding and lodging provided by Manila Central University.

Why MBBS in the Philippines?

With its 90% literacy rate, the Philippines is a tropical paradise and a popular study destination for international students in Asia. The Philippines also attracts students from other continents who are looking for affordable academic education in an exotic place. As the largest English-speaking country in the South East Asia region, the Philippines is the best place to access high-quality medical education at affordable prices. All of the Medical Colleges and Medical Courses offered by these Colleges are recognized worldwide thus the students can gain Practical Knowledge with a huge number of lab exercises.

MBBS in the Philippines is cost-effective. The tuition fees are affordable and can be paid in multiple installments.

The universities in the Philippines follow the US Education System thus students will have credit transfer options to continue studying medicine in America. The same American college system, the same benefits, and solid structure, but without the student debt and huge tuition fees.

The Philippines has Internationally recognized Medical colleges which are listed in World Health Organization (WHO) and supported by the foreign medical graduate council. The Universities and the Courses offered by the Philippine Medical Colleges are recognized worldwide.

Affordable living expenses

Compared to other Asian countries majority of Filipinos has a facility for the English language and so Indian students feel comfortable. There is no demand to learn the local language.

The Universities are known for their modern teaching techniques, superior quality medical education, and world-class amenities.

Documents required and procedures for applying for MBBS in Manila Central University.

Transcript of Record (TOR)

Honorable Dismissal/Transfer Credentials

NMAT/ NEET Result

Birth Certificate

Certificate of Good Moral from Academic Dean and Office of Student Affairs

Notarized Affidavit of Support with Bank Statement

Three (3) Recommendation Letters from your professors.

Receipt of Processing Fee

Receipt of Developmental Fee

How to apply?

What is the eligibility to study for MBBS at Manila Central University?

The age of the applicant should be 17+ years as of 31st of December of the year.

The applicant must qualify for NEET (National Eligibility Entrance Test).

An aggregate of 50% in Physics, Chemistry, and Biology.

Common FAQs about MBBS in the Philippines

Is NEET Mandatory to Study MBBS in the Philippines?

Yes

Is IELTS/TOEFL Mandatory to Study MBBS In the Philippines?

No

Do MBBS universities in the Philippines help prepare for PLAB/USMLE

Yes

Is IELTS mandatory for PLAB/USMLE?

Yes

Is internship mandatory for MBBS in the Philippines?

Yes. A 1-year internship is mandatory.

Can I do an internship in India after completing my MBBS in the Philippines?

Depends on the university

Which is the best university in the Philippines to study MBBS for an Indian student?

It depends on the preferred subject and the budget of the student.

What are the age criteria to study MBBS in the Philippines?

The student must be 17 years of age or above.

Is an MBBS degree from the Philippines accepted in India?

MBBS degree from the Philippines is recognized globally. Hence, it’s valid in India.

Is veg food available in the Philippines?

Indian veg/non-veg food is available in the Philippines.

How many MCI-approved medical colleges are in the Philippines?
